answers.answer: Hello~You may have a yeast infection in the gut called "Candida" this will cause lots of the symptoms you are mentioning. I would ask your GP about it, have a stool test taken as that is the best way to diagnose it. In the meantime, avoid all sugars, glutens, wheat, yeast and high carbs, all these are growing grounds for Candida.

question: My symptoms.  October high BP, naseau, headaches, diahrea, and fatigue.  All still happening except naseau and headache is off and on.  Diahrea became loose soft stools.  February dry mouth almost like burning, white coated tongue, whole GI tract making gurgling noises with gas, hurts to lay on right side, skin rashes like psoriasis.  Stomach still acting up and white tongue.  STD test nrgative for HIV and all the different bacteria ones.  My wife in February inverse psoriasis and just finally went away, diabetes, headaches off and on.
title: Std or any other viral disease?
